document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the spider genera Agyneta and Tennesseellum (Araneae, Linyphiidae) of North America north of Mexico with a study of the embolic division within Micronetinae sensu Saaristo & Tanasevitch 1996

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the spider genera Agyneta and Tennesseellum (Araneae, Linyphiidae) of North America north of Mexico with a study of the embolic division within Micronetinae sensu Saaristo & Tanasevitch 1996

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material:
Male holotype from Canada , British Columbia , Cross Creek, 2 mi . W Babine Lake,
05.viii. 1987
, moss beside creek, R. West ( CNC ). EXAMINED .
Etymology: The specific name is adjective in apposition meaning transparent, in reference to the somewhat transparent lamella characteristica of the male palp.

Diagnosis: Males can be differentiated from all
Agyneta
species by the unique V-shaped lamella characteristica (
Fig. 90
). From
A. protrudens
by the long apical pocket of paracymbium (
Fig. 90
), shorter in the latter (
Fig. 97
). Females are distinguished from most species by the large peanut-shaped receptacula of the internal genitalia (
Fig. 95
). From
A. decora
and
A. protrudens
by the short sinuous sides on the proximal part of scape (
Fig. 94
), long in
A. decora
(
Fig. 68
) and straight in
A. protrudens
(
Fig. 101
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description:
Male :
Total length 1.60; carapace length 0.70, width 0.59.

caption.paragraph:

Agyneta allosubtilis Loksa 1965
. 79–82, Male. 83–85, Female. 79. Palp, retrolateral view. 80. Palp, prolateral view. 81. Embolus, prolateral view. 82. Radical division, retrolateral view. 83. Epigynum, ventral view (arrow points to tent-shaped marking). 84. Internal genitalia, ventral view. 85. Internal genitalia dorsal view.

FIGURES 86–89.
Agyneta aquila
n. sp. 86–89, Male. 86. Palp, retrolateral view. 87. Palp, prolateral view. 88. Embolus, prolateral view. 89. Radical division, retrolateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Female :
Total length 1.78; carapace length 0.72, width 0.52.
